TEXT.citation: Indosan, S., Wakelin, G., Dararyaw, S., and Kalaku, S. (1958). Yami texts. Work Papers of the Summer Institute of Linguistics, University of North Dakota Session: Vol. 2, Article 7. 10.31356/silwp.vol02.07
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @article{indosan1958yami, title={Yami texts}, year={1958}, author={Indosan, Samen and Wakelin, Grace and Dararyaw, Sinan and Kalaku, Saman}, journal={Work Papers of the Summer Institute of Linguistics, University of North Dakota Session}, volume={2}, number={7}, doi={10.31356/silwp.vol02.07}

S.FORM: tau nu kakwa amyan su avang tu titiwen kwan-da
tao no kakwa amyan so avang to titiwen kwan-da
S.TRANSL: A long time ago, there was a ship at Titiwen.

S.FORM: ma-chita-da tu madegdeg (imurud nu tau)/(tau d-imurud)
ma-chita-da to madegdeg (imorod no tao)/(tao d-imorod)
S.TRANSL: Early in the morning, the people from Imurud saw them (ship's crew).

S.FORM: ma-chita-da ipanchi-na u anak-na
ma-chita-da ipanchi-na o anak-na
S.TRANSL: The child said, "Look at them."

S.FORM: sira(unctn) mi-ripu-ripus mang-aep-tamu su matengteng utwen kwan-da
sira(onctn) mi-ripo-ripos mang-aep-tamo so matengteng otwen kwan-da
S.TRANSL: His relatives said, "Let's take some cold food

S.FORM: ituru-tamu-dira kwan-da m-angay-tamu lu tatala kwan-da
itoro-tamo-dira kwan-da m-angay-tamo lo tatala kwan-da
S.TRANSL: to give them, and go over in our boat."

S.FORM: nun kwan-da m-angay-sira lu tatala m-angay titiwen.
non kwan-da m-angay-sira lo tatala m-angay titiwen.
S.TRANSL: They went by boat to Titiwen,

S.FORM: ma-chita-da u avang nikumagat
ma-chita-da o avang nikomagat
S.TRANSL: and saw the wrecked ship.

S.FORM: tau nu avang mamimin-sira ni-m-angay lu katyan miwalem lu rerchip
tao no avang mamimin-sira ni-m-angay lo katyan miwalem lo rerchip
S.TRANSL: All the people from the ship had gone to Katyan and were resting in the cave.

S.FORM: u tatala nu tau pangyiden-da
o tatala no tao pangyiden-da
S.TRANSL: The newcomers with the food pulled the boat up on the shore.

S.FORM: k-aep-da su utwen-da-rana
k-aep-da so otwen-da-rana
S.TRANSL: The newcomers with the food pulled the boat up on the shore.

S.FORM: ma-chita-da nu dewdew ina-kamu-pa su kanen kwan-da
ma-chita-da no dewdew ina-kamo-pa so kanen kwan-da
S.TRANSL: As soon as the foreigners saw it, they said, "Give us some food."

S.FORM: ipanchi nu tau i-kongu-kamu-ya chiri-chiring nu dewdew yamen va-vawden-inyu kwan-da
ipanchi no tao i-kongo-kamo-ya chiri-chiring no dewdew yamen va-vawden-inyo kwan-da
S.TRANSL: The newcomers said, "Why are you here?" The foreigners replied, "You've come to bind us?"

S.FORM: chiri-chiring nu tau ning kwan-da nukumwanem vawden-tamu sira kwan-da
chiri-chiring no tao ning kwan-da nokomwanem vawden-tamo sira kwan-da
S.TRANSL: "Yes, let's bind them,

S.FORM: k-aep-da su talili-da nu dewdew kwan-da
k-aep-da so talili-da no dewdew kwan-da
S.TRANSL: and take their clothes," the newcomers said.

S.FORM: asa panisiringen-da kari ka-ma-kungu mu-ka-di-mi-lis-an kwan-da nu tau
asa panisiringen-da kari ka-ma-kongo mo-ka-di-mi-lis-an kwan-da no tao
S.TRANSL: One of them was the leader. The newcomer said, "Get out! Why don't you move?"

S.FORM: maniring u dewdew chyaa? di-kung-mi-lis
maniring o dewdew chyaa? di-kong-mi-lis
S.TRANSL: The foreigner replied, "It doesn't make any difference whether I move or not. I won't move!"

S.FORM: u nak-nakem nu tau i-kungu na-di-mi-lis-i
o nak-nakem no tao i-kongo na-di-mi-lis-i
S.TRANSL: Then they wondered, "Why doesn't he move?"

S.FORM: ala amyan su uvay-da kwan-a nu ama-da
ala amyan so ovay-da kwan-a no ama-da
S.TRANSL: "I know he has some gold," said their father.

S.FORM: tuna-pi-lis-a kari kwan-a amyan su uvay-da lu lisnen-na amuri di-na-mi-lis-i
tona-pi-lis-a kari kwan-a amyan so ovay-da lo lisnen-na amori di-na-mi-lis-i
S.TRANSL: Giving him a shove, he said, "Get out! There is some gold under his seat and that's why he doesn't move."

S.FORM: ma-chita-na nu ama-da tunang-aep-a tu ni-lisnen-a k-aep-na-rana-sya nu ama-da
ma-chita-na no ama-da tonang-aep-a to ni-lisnen-a k-aep-na-rana-sya no ama-da
S.TRANSL: When the father saw it, he grabbed it from under the seat.

S.FORM: u panisiringen-da-m tu-rana-lavi ikapaw-na uvay-da ni-aep nu tau
o panisiringen-da-m to-rana-lavi ikapaw-na ovay-da ni-aep no tao
S.TRANSL: The leader cried because he liked his gold that had been taken.

S.FORM: malalayu-rana sira m-angay lu tatala emragbit
malalayo-rana sira m-angay lo tatala emragbit
S.TRANSL: They ran to the boat,

S.FORM: tirarawa-kamu m-angay lu pik-il-ili-na
tirarawa-kamo m-angay lo pik-il-ili-na
S.TRANSL: and went to their villages.
